Course.Course_Description: A survey of fundamental concepts in computer science, including programming, algorithms, data structures, and computational thinking.
A rigorous introduction to differential and integral calculus, including limits, derivatives, integrals, and applications.
An overview of basic psychological principles, including sensation and perception, learning and memory, motivation and emotion, and social psychology.
A study of the economy as a whole, including national income, inflation, unemployment, and economic growth.
An introduction to the fundamental principles of biology, including cell structure and function, genetics, evolution, and ecology.
A study of human society, including social structures, groups, organizations, and social change.
A study of the fundamental principles of chemistry, including atoms, molecules, chemical bonding, and reactions.
A survey of major historical events and figures, from ancient times to the present.
An exploration of classic and contemporary literary works, including poetry, fiction, drama, and nonfiction.
A survey of major art movements and styles, from ancient times to the present.
A survey of major musical genres and composers, from ancient times to the present.
